content.text: Calculate the value of bond B shown in the following table, all of which pay interest semiannually. <image 1>

To calculate the value of bond B, we need to use the bond valuation formula. The formula is:

\[ \text{Bond Value} = \left( \frac{\text{Coupon Payment}}{\text{Required Rate of Return}} \right) \times \left( 1 - \frac{1}{(1 + \text{Required Rate of Return})^{\text{Number of Periods}}} \right) + \frac{\text{Par Value}}{(1 + \text{Required Rate of Return})^{\text{Number of Periods}}} \]

Given:
- Par value = $1,000
- Coupon interest rate = 12% ( (semi-annual payment, so 6% per period)
- Years to maturity = 20 ( (semi-annual payments, so 40 periods)
- Required stated annual return = 12% ( (semi-annual payments, so 6% per period)

Plugging these values into the formula:

\[ \text{Bond Value} = \left( \frac{{1,000 \times 0.06}{0.06} \right) \times \left( 1 - \frac{1}{(1 + 0.06)^{40}} \right) + \frac{1,000}{(1 + 0.06)^{40}} \]

\[ \text{Bond Value} = 1,000 \times \left( 1 - \frac{1}{(1.06)^{40}} \right) + \frac{1,000}{(1.06)^{40}} \]

\[ \text{Bond Value} = 1,000 \times \left( 1 - \frac{1}{2.2999} \right) + \frac{1,000}{2.2999} \]

\[ \text{Bond Value} = 1,000 \times \left( 1 - 0.4357 \right) + 435.78 \]

\[ \text{Bond Value} = 1,000 \times 0.5643 + 435.78 \]

\[ \text{Bond Value} = 564.30 + 435.78 \]

\[ \text{Bond Value} = 1,000.08 \]

So, the value of bond B is approximately $1,000.08.
